replaced with their more common usage (such as \"Bolivia\" instead\nof \"Bolivia, Plurinational State of\").\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo retain the official ISO 3166-1 naming for all fields, set the\n\u003ccode\u003eCOUNTRIES_COMMON_NAMES\u003c/code\u003e setting to \u003ccode\u003eFalse\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf your project requires the use of alternative names, the inclusion or\nexclusion of specific countries then set the \u003ccode\u003eCOUNTRIES_OVERRIDE\u003c/code\u003e setting to\na dictionary of names which override the defaults. The values can also use a\nmore \u003ca href=\"#complex-dictionary-format\"\u003ecomplex dictionary format\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNote that you will need to handle translation of customised country names.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eSetting a country's name to \u003ccode\u003eNone\u003c/code\u003e will exclude it from the country list.\nFor example:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"from django.utils.translation import gettext_lazy as _\n\nCOUNTRIES_OVERRIDE = {\n    \u0026quot;NZ\u0026quot;: _(\u0026quot;Middle Earth\u0026quot;),\n    \u0026quot;AU\u0026quot;: None,\n    \u0026quot;US\u0026quot;: {\n        \u0026quot;names\u0026quot;: [\n            _(\u0026quot;United States of America\u0026quot;),\n            _(\u0026quot;America\u0026quot;),\n        ],\n    },\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003efrom\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003edjango\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003eutils\u003c/span\u003e.\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003etranslation\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eimport\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003egettext_lazy\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003eas\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003e_\u003c/span\u003e\n\n\u003cspan class=\"pl-v\"\u003eCOUNTRIES_OVERRIDE\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e {\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"NZ\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e_\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"Middle Earth\"\u003c/span\u003e),\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"AU\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003eNone\u003c/span\u003e,\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"US\"\u003c/span\u003e: {\n        \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"names\"\u003c/span\u003e: [\n            \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e_\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"United States of America\"\u003c/span\u003e),\n            \u003cspan class=\"pl-en\"\u003e_\u003c/span\u003e(\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\"America\"\u003c/span\u003e),\n        ],\n    },\n}\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you have a specific list of countries that should be used, data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"COUNTRIES_ONLY = [\u0026quot;NZ\u0026quot;, \u0026quot;AU\u0026quot;]\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-v\"\u003eCOUNTRIES_ONLY\u003c/span\u003e and they\nwill be shown first in the countries list (in the order specified) before all\nthe alphanumerically sorted countries.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you want to sort these initial countries too, set the\n\u003ccode\u003eCOUNTRIES_FIRST_SORT\u003c/code\u003e setting to \u003ccode\u003eTrue\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eBy default, these initial countries are not repeated again in the\nalphanumerically sorted list. If you would like them to be repeated, set the\n\u003ccode\u003eCOUNTRIES_FIRST_REPEAT\u003c/code\u003e setting to \u003ccode\u003eTrue\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFinally, you can optionally separate these \"first\" countries with an empty\nchoice by providing the choice label as the \u003ccode\u003eCOUNTRIES_FIRST_BREAK\u003c/code\u003e setting.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ca name=\"user-content-customize-the-flag-url\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eCustomize the flag URL\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-customize-the-flag-url\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Customize the flag URL\" href=\"#customize-the-flag-url\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe \u003ccode\u003eCOUNTRIES_FLAG_URL\u003c/code\u003e setting can be used to set the url for the flag\nimage assets. It defaults to:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"COUNTRIES_FLAG_URL = \u0026quot;flags/{code}.gif\u0026quot;\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-v\"\u003eCOUNTRIES_FLAG_URL\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan URL.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe location is parsed using Python's string formatting and is passed the\nfollowing arguments:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ecode\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ecode_upper\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFor example: \u003ccode\u003eCOUNTRIES_FLAG_URL = \"flags/16x10/{code_upper}.png\"\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eNo checking is done to ensure that a static flag actually exists.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAlternatively, you can specify a different URL on a specific \u003ccode\u003eCountryField\u003c/code\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" options within the dictionary are:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdl\u003e\n\u003cdt\u003e\u003ccode\u003ename\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003enames\u003c/code\u003e If using multiple names, the first name takes preference\nwhen using \u003ccode\u003eCOUNTRIES_FIRST\u003c/code\u003e or the \u003ccode\u003eCountry.name\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/dd\u003e\n\u003cdt\u003e\u003ccode\u003ealpha3\u003c/code\u003e (optional)\u003c/dt\u003e\n\u003cdd\u003eAn ISO 3166-1 three character code (or an empty string to nullify an existing\ncode for this country.\u003c/dd\u003e\n\u003cdt\u003e\u003ccode\u003enumeric\u003c/code\u003e (optional)\u003c/dt\u003e\n\u003cdd\u003eAn ISO 3166-1 numeric country code (or \u003ccode\u003eNone\u003c/code\u003e to nullify an existing code\nfor this country. The numeric codes 900 to 999 are left available by the\nstandard for user-assignment.\u003c/dd\u003e\n\u003cdt\u003e\u003ccode\u003eioc_code\u003c/code\u003e (optional)\u003c/dt\u003e\n\u003cdd\u003eThe country's International Olympic Committee code (or an empty string to\nnullify an existing code).\u003c/dd\u003e\n\u003c/dl\u003e\n\u003ca name=\"user-content-country-object-external-plugins\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003eCountry\u003c/code\u003e object external plugins\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-country-object-external-plugins\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Country object external plugins\" href=\"#country-object-external-plugins\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eOther Python packages can add attributes to the \u003ca href=\"#the-country-object\"\u003eCountry\u003c/a\u003e object by using entry\npoints in their setup script.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eFor example, you could create a \u003ccode\u003edjango_countries_phone\u003c/code\u003e package which had a\nwith the following entry point in the \u003ccode\u003esetup.py\u003c/code\u003e file. names, install it with theoptional <a href="https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pyuca/" rel="nofollow">pyuca</a> package:</p><p dir="auto"><code>pip install django-countries[pyuca]</code></p></li><li><p dir="auto">Add <code>django_countries</code> to <code>INSTALLED_APPS</code></p></li></ol><a name="user-content-countryfield"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">CountryField</h2><a id="user-content-countryfield" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: CountryField" href="#countryfield"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">A country field for Django models that provides all ISO 3166-1 countries aschoices.</p><p dir="auto"><code>CountryField</code> is based on Django's <code>CharField</code>, providing choicescorresponding to the official ISO 3166-1 list of countries (with a default<code>max_length</code> of 2).</p><p dir="auto">Consider the following model using a <code>CountryField</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from django.db import modelsfrom django_countries.fields import CountryFieldclass Person(models.Model):    name = models.CharField(max_length=100)    country = CountryField()"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">django</span>.<span class="pl-s1">db</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">models</span><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">django_countries</span>.<span class="pl-s1">fields</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">CountryField</span><span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">Person</span>(<span class="pl-s1">models</span>.<span class="pl-v">Model</span>):    <span class="pl-s1">name</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">models</span>.<span class="pl-v">CharField</span>(<span class="pl-s1">max_length</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">100</span>)    <span class="pl-s1">country</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">CountryField</span>()</pre></div><p dir="auto">Any <code>Person</code> instance will have a <code>country</code> attribute that you can use toget details of the person's country:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> person = Person(name="Chris", country="NZ")>>> person.countryCountry(code='NZ')>>> person.country.name'New Zealand'>>> person.country.flag'/static/flags/nz.gif'"><pre><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-s1">person</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">Person</span>(<span class="pl-s1">name</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s">"Chris"</span>, <span class="pl-s1">country</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s">"NZ"</span>)<span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-s1">person</span>.<span class="pl-s1">country</span><span class="pl-v">Country</span>(<span class="pl-s1">code</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s">'NZ'</span>)<span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-s1">person</span>.<span class="pl-s1">country</span>.<span class="pl-s1">name</span><span class="pl-s">'New Zealand'</span><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-s1">person</span>.<span class="pl-s1">country</span>.<span class="pl-s1">flag</span><span class="pl-s">'/static/flags/nz.gif'</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">This object (<code>person.country</code> in the example) is a <code>Country</code> instance,which is described below.</p><p dir="auto">Use <code>blank_label</code> to set the label for the initial blank choice shown informs:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="country = CountryField(blank_label="(select country)")"><pre><span class="pl-s1">country</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">CountryField</span>(<span class="pl-s1">blank_label</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s">"(select country)"</span>)</pre></div><p dir="auto">You can filter using the full English country names in addition to countrycodes, even though only the country codes are stored in the database by usingthe queryset lookups <code>contains</code>, <code>startswith</code>, <code>endswith</code>, <code>regex</code>, ortheir case insensitive versions. Use <code>__name</code> or <code>__iname</code> for the<code>exact</code>/<code>iexact</code> equivalent:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> Person.objects.filter(country__name="New Zealand").count()1>>> Person.objects.filter(country__icontains="zealand").count()1"><pre><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-v">Person</span>.<span class="pl-s1">objects</span>.<span class="pl-en">filter</span>(<span class="pl-s1">country__name</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s">"New Zealand"</span>).<span class="pl-en">count</span>()<span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-v">Person</span>.<span class="pl-s1">objects</span>.<span class="pl-en">filter</span>(<span class="pl-s1">country__icontains</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s">"zealand"</span>).<span class="pl-en">count</span>()<span class="pl-c1">1</span></pre></div><a name="user-content-multi-choice"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Multi-choice</h3><a id="user-content-multi-choice" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Multi-choice" href="#multi-choice"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">This field can also allow multiple selections of countries (saved as a commaseparated string). The field will always output a list of countries in thismode. For example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="class Incident(models.Model):    title = models.CharField(max_length=100)    countries = CountryField(multiple=True)>>> for country in Incident.objects.get(title="Pavlova dispute").countries:...     print(country.name)AustraliaNew Zealand"><pre><span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">Incident</span>(<span class="pl-s1">models</span>.<span class="pl-v">Model</span>):    <span class="pl-s1">title</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">models</span>.<span class="pl-v">CharField</span>(<span class="pl-s1">max_length</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">100</span>)    <span class="pl-s1">countries</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">CountryField</span>(<span class="pl-s1">multiple</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">True</span>)<span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-k">for</span> <span class="pl-s1">country</span> <span class="pl-c1">in</span> <span class="pl-v">Incident</span>.<span class="pl-s1">objects</span>.<span class="pl-en">get</span>(<span class="pl-s1">title</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s">"Pavlova dispute"</span>).<span class="pl-s1">countries</span>:...     <span class="pl-s1">print</span>(<span class="pl-s1">country</span>.<span class="pl-s1">name</span>)<span class="pl-v">Australia</span><span class="pl-v">New</span> <span class="pl-v">Zealand</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">By default, countries are stored sorted for data consistency, and anyduplicates are removed. These behaviours can be overridden by using the fieldarguments <code>multiple_sort=False</code> and <code>multiple_unique=False</code> respectively.</p><a name="user-content-the-country-object"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">The <code>Country</code> object</h3><a id="user-content-the-country-object" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: The Country object" href="#the-country-object"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">An object used to represent a country, instantiated with a two charactercountry code, three character code, or numeric code.</p><p dir="auto">It can be compared to other objects as if it was a string containing thecountry code and when evaluated as text, returns the country code.</p><dl><dt>name</dt><dd>Contains the full country name.</dd><dt>flag</dt><dd>Contains a URL to the flag. If you page could have lots of different flagsthen consider using <code>flag_css</code> instead to avoid excessive HTTP requests.</dd><dt>flag_css</dt><dd><p dir="auto">Output the css classes needed to display an HTML element as the correct flagfrom within a single sprite image that contains all flags. For example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-html-django notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="<link rel="stylesheet" href="{% static 'flags/sprite.css' %}"><i class="{{ country.flag_css }}"></i>"><pre><<span class="pl-ent">link</span> <span class="pl-e">rel</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>stylesheet<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> <span class="pl-e">href</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>{% static 'flags/sprite.css' %}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>><<span class="pl-ent">i</span> <span class="pl-e">class</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>{{ country.flag_css }}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>></<span class="pl-ent">i</span>></pre></div><p dir="auto">For multiple flag resolutions, use <code>sprite-hq.css</code> instead and add the<code>flag2x</code>, <code>flag3x</code>, or <code>flag4x</code> class. For example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-html-django notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="<link rel="stylesheet" href="{% static 'flags/sprite-hq.css' %}">Normal: <i class="{{ country.flag_css }}"></i>Bigger: <i class="flag2x {{ country.flag_css }}"></i>"><pre><<span class="pl-ent">link</span> <span class="pl-e">rel</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>stylesheet<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> <span class="pl-e">href</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>{% static 'flags/sprite-hq.css' %}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>>Normal: <<span class="pl-ent">i</span> <span class="pl-e">class</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>{{ country.flag_css }}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>></<span class="pl-ent">i</span>>Bigger: <<span class="pl-ent">i</span> <span class="pl-e">class</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>flag2x {{ country.flag_css }}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>></<span class="pl-ent">i</span>></pre></div><p dir="auto">You might also want to consider using <code>aria-label</code> for betteraccessibility:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-html-django notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="<i class="{{ country.flag_css }}"    aria-label="{% blocktrans with country_code=country.code %}        {{ country_code }} flag    {% endblocktrans %}"></i>"><pre><<span class="pl-ent">i</span> <span class="pl-e">class</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>{{ country.flag_css }}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>    <span class="pl-e">aria-label</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>{% blocktrans with country_code=country.code %}</span><span class="pl-s">        {{ country_code }} flag</span><span class="pl-s">    {% endblocktrans %}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>></<span class="pl-ent">i</span>></pre></div></dd><dt>unicode_flag</dt><dd>A unicode glyph for the flag for this country. Currently well-supported iniOS and OS X. See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regional_Indicator_Symbol" rel="nofollow">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regional_Indicator_Symbol</a>for details.</dd><dt>code</dt><dd>The two letter country code for this country.</dd><dt>alpha3</dt><dd>The three letter country code for this country.</dd><dt>numeric</dt><dd>The numeric country code for this country (as an integer).</dd><dt>numeric_padded</dt><dd>The numeric country code as a three character 0-padded string.</dd><dt>ioc_code</dt><dd>The three letter International Olympic Committee country code.</dd></dl><a name="user-content-countryselectwidget"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>CountrySelectWidget</code></h3><a id="user-content-countryselectwidget" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: CountrySelectWidget" href="#countryselectwidget"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">A widget is included that can show the flag image after the select box(updated with JavaScript when the selection changes).</p><p dir="auto">When you create your form, you can use this custom widget like normal:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from django_countries.widgets import CountrySelectWidgetclass PersonForm(forms.ModelForm):    class Meta:        model = models.Person        fields = ("name", "country")        widgets = {"country": CountrySelectWidget()}"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">django_countries</span>.<span class="pl-s1">widgets</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">CountrySelectWidget</span><span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">PersonForm</span>(<span class="pl-s1">forms</span>.<span class="pl-v">ModelForm</span>):    <span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">Meta</span>:        <span class="pl-s1">model</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">models</span>.<span class="pl-v">Person</span>        <span class="pl-s1">fields</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> (<span class="pl-s">"name"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"country"</span>)        <span class="pl-s1">widgets</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> {<span class="pl-s">"country"</span>: <span class="pl-v">CountrySelectWidget</span>()}</pre></div><p dir="auto">Pass a <code>layout</code> text argument to the widget to change the positioning of theflag and widget. The default layout is:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="'{widget}<img class="country-select-flag" id="{flag_id}" style="margin: 6px 4px 0" src="{country.flag}">'"><pre><span class="pl-s">'{widget}<img class="country-select-flag" id="{flag_id}" style="margin: 6px 4px 0" src="{country.flag}">'</span></pre></div><a name="user-content-custom-forms"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Custom forms</h2><a height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">If you want to use the countries in a custom form, use the model field's customform field to ensure the translatable strings for the country choices are leftlazy until the widget renders:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from django_countries.fields import CountryFieldclass CustomForm(forms.Form):    country = CountryField().formfield()"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">django_countries</span>.<span class="pl-s1">fields</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">CountryField</span><span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">CustomForm</span>(<span class="pl-s1">forms</span>.<span class="pl-v">Form</span>):    <span class="pl-s1">country</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">CountryField</span>().<span class="pl-en">formfield</span>()</pre></div><p dir="auto">Use <code>CountryField(blank=True)</code> for non-required form fields, and<code>CountryField(blank_label="(Select country)")</code> to use a custom label for theinitial blank option.</p><p dir="auto">You can also use the <a href="#countryselectwidget">CountrySelectWidget</a> as the widget for this field if youwant the flag image after the select box.</p><a name="user-content-get-the-countries-from-python"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Get the countries from by name).</p><p dir="auto">For example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=">>> from django_countries import countries>>> dict(countries)["NZ"]'New Zealand'>>> for code, name in list(countries)[:3]:...     print(f"{name} ({code})")...Afghanistan (AF)Åland Islands (AX)Albania (AL)"><pre><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">django_countries</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">countries</span><span class="pl-c1">>></span><span class="pl-c1">></span> <span class="pl-en">dict</span>(<span class="pl-s1">countries</span>)[<span class="pl-s">"NZ"</span>]<span class="pl-c1">in</span> <span class="pl-en">list</span>(<span class="pl-s1">countries</span>)[:<span class="pl-c1">3</span>]:...     <span class="pl-s1">print</span>(<span class="pl-s">f"<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-s1">name</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span></span> (<span class="pl-s1"><span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-s1">code</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span></span>)"</span>)...<span class="pl-v">Afghanistan</span> (<span class="pl-v">AF</span>)<span class="pl-s1">Åland</span> <span class="pl-v">Islands</span> (<span class="pl-v">AX</span>)<span class="pl-v">Albania</span> (<span class="pl-v">AL</span>)</pre></div><a name="user-content-template-tags"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" a <code>Country</code> object andhave access to all of its properties:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-html-django notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{% load countries %}{% get_country 'BR' as country %}{{ country.name }}"><pre><span class="pl-e">{%</span> <span class="pl-k">load</span> <span class="pl-s">countries</span> <span class="pl-e">%}</span><span class="pl-e">{%</span> <span class="pl-s">get_country</span> <span class="pl-s">'BR'</span> <span class="pl-k">as</span> <span class="pl-s">country</span> <span class="pl-e">%}</span>{{ country.name }}</pre></div><p dir="auto">If you need a list of countries, there's also a simple tag for that:</p><div class="highlight highlight-text-html-django notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{% load countries %}{% get_countries as countries %}<select>{% for country in countries %}    <option value="{{ country.code }}">{{ country.name }}</option>{% endfor %}</select>"><pre><span class="pl-e">{%</span> <span class="pl-k">load</span> <span class="pl-s">countries</span> <span class="pl-e">%}</span><span class="pl-e">{%</span> <span class="pl-s">get_countries</span> <span class="pl-k">as</span> <span class="pl-s">countries</span> <span class="pl-e">%}</span><<span class="pl-ent">select</span>><span class="pl-e">{%</span> <span class="pl-k">for</span> <span class="pl-s">country</span> <span class="pl-k">in</span> <span class="pl-s">countries</span> <span class="pl-e">%}</span>    <<span class="pl-ent">option</span> <span class="pl-e">value</span>=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>{{ country.code }}<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>>{{ country.name }}</<span class="pl-ent">option</span>><span class="pl-e">{%</span> <span class="pl-k">endfor</span> <span class="pl-e">%}</span></<span viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Country names are taken from the official ISO 3166-1 list, with some countrynames being replaced with their more common usage (such as "Bolivia" insteadof "Bolivia, Plurinational State of").</p><p dir="auto">To retain the official ISO 3166-1 naming for all fields, set the<code>COUNTRIES_COMMON_NAMES</code> setting to <code>False</code>.</p><p dir="auto">If your project requires the use of alternative names, the inclusion orexclusion of specific countries then set the <code>COUNTRIES_OVERRIDE</code> setting toa dictionary of names which override the defaults. The values can also use amore <a href="#complex-dictionary-format">complex dictionary format</a>.</p><p dir="auto">Note that you will need to handle translation of customised country names.</p><p dir="auto">Setting a country's name to <code>None</code> will exclude it from the country list.For example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from django.utils.translation import gettext_lazy as _COUNTRIES_OVERRIDE = {    "NZ": _("Middle Earth"),    "AU": None,    "US": {        "names": [            _("United States of America"),            _("America"),        ],    },}"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">django</span>.<span class="pl-s1">utils</span>.<span class="pl-s1">translation</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">gettext_lazy</span> <span class="pl-k">as</span> <span class="pl-s1">_</span><span class="pl-v">COUNTRIES_OVERRIDE</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> {    <span class="pl-s">"NZ"</span>: <span class="pl-en">_</span>(<span class="pl-s">"Middle Earth"</span>),    <span class="pl-s">"AU"</span>: <span class="pl-c1">None</span>,    <span class="pl-s">"US"</span>: {        <span class="pl-s">"names"</span>: [            <span class="pl-en">_</span>(<span class="pl-s">"United States of America"</span>),            <span class="pl-en">_</span>(<span class="pl-s">"America"</span>),        ],    },}</pre></div><p dir="auto">If you have a specific list of countries that should be used, use<code>COUNTRIES_ONLY</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="COUNTRIES_ONLY = ["NZ", "AU"]"><pre><span class="pl-v">COUNTRIES_ONLY</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> [<span class="pl-s">"NZ"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"AU"</span>]</pre></div><p dir="auto">or to specify your own country names, use a dictionary or two-tuple list(string items will use the standard country name):</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="COUNTRIES_ONLY = [    "US",    "GB",    ("NZ", _("Middle Earth")),    ("AU", _("Desert")),]"><pre><span class="pl-v">COUNTRIES_ONLY</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> [    <span class="pl-s">"US"</span>,    <span class="pl-s">"GB"</span>,    (<span class="pl-s">"NZ"</span>, <span class="pl-en">_</span>(<span class="pl-s">"Middle Earth"</span>)),    (<span class="pl-s">"AU"</span>, <span class="pl-en">_</span>(<span class="pl-s">"Desert"</span>)),]</pre></div><a name="user-content-show-certain-countries-first"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Show certain countries first</h3><a id="user-content-show-certain-countries-first" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Show certain countries first" href="#show-certain-countries-first"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Provide a list of country codes as the <code>COUNTRIES_FIRST</code> setting and theywill be shown first in the countries list (in the order specified) before allthe alphanumerically sorted countries.</p><p dir="auto">If you want to sort these initial countries too, set the<code>COUNTRIES_FIRST_SORT</code> setting to <code>True</code>.</p><p dir="auto">By default, these initial countries are not repeated again in thealphanumerically sorted list. If you would like them to be repeated, set the<code>COUNTRIES_FIRST_REPEAT</code> setting to <code>True</code>.</p><p dir="auto">Finally, you can optionally separate these "first" countries with an emptychoice by providing the choice label as the <code>COUNTRIES_FIRST_BREAK</code> setting.</p><a name="user-content-customize-the-flag-url"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Customize the flag URL</h3><a id="user-content-customize-the-flag-url" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Customize the flag URL" href="#customize-the-flag-url"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The <code>COUNTRIES_FLAG_URL</code> setting can be used to set the url for the flagimage assets. It defaults to:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="COUNTRIES_FLAG_URL = "flags/{code}.gif""><pre><span class="pl-v">COUNTRIES_FLAG_URL</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s">"flags/{code}.gif"</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">The URL can be relative to the STATIC_URL setting, or an absolute URL.</p><p dir="auto">The location is parsed using Python's string formatting and is passed thefollowing arguments:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>code</code></li><li><code>code_upper</code></li></ul><p dir="auto">For example: <code>COUNTRIES_FLAG_URL = "flags/16x10/{code_upper}.png"</code></p><p dir="auto">No checking is done to ensure that a static flag actually exists.</p><p dir="auto">Alternatively, you can specify a different URL on a specific <code>CountryField</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="class Person(models.Model):    name = models.CharField(max_length=100)    country = CountryField(        countries_flag_url="//flags.example.com/{code}.png")"><pre><span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">Person</span>(<span class="pl-s1">models</span>.<span class="pl-v">Model</span>):    <span class="pl-s1">name</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">models</span>.<span class="pl-v">CharField</span>(<span class="pl-s1">max_length</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-c1">100</span>)    <span class="pl-s1">country</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">CountryField</span>(        <span class="pl-s1">countries_flag_url</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s">"//flags.example.com/{code}.png"</span>)</pre></div><a name="user-content-single-field-customization"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Single field customization</h3><a id="user-content-single-field-customization" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Single field customization" href="#single-field-customization"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">To customize an individual field, rather than rely on project level settings,create a <code>Countries</code> subclass which overrides settings.</p><p dir="auto">To override a setting, give the class an attribute matching the lowercasedsetting without the <code>COUNTRIES_</code> prefix.</p><p dir="auto">Then just reference this class in a field. For example, this <code>CountryField</code>uses a custom country list that only includes the G8 countries:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from django_countries import Countriesclass G8Countries(Countries):    only = [        "CA", "FR", "DE", "IT", "JP", "RU", "GB",        ("EU", _("European Union"))    ]class Vote(models.Model):    country = CountryField(countries=G8Countries)    approve = models.BooleanField()"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">django_countries</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">Countries</span><span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">G8Countries</span>(<span class="pl-v">Countries</span>):    <span class="pl-s1">only</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> [        <span class="pl-s">"CA"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"FR"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"DE"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"IT"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"JP"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"RU"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"GB"</span>,        (<span class="pl-s">"EU"</span>, <span class="pl-en">_</span>(<span class="pl-s">"European Union"</span>))    ]<span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">Vote</span>(<span class="pl-s1">models</span>.<span class="pl-v">Model</span>):    <span class="pl-s1">country</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">CountryField</span>(<span class="pl-s1">countries</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-v">G8Countries</span>)    <span class="pl-s1">approve</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">models</span>.<span class="pl-v">BooleanField</span>()</pre></div><a name="user-content-complex-dictionary-format"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Complex dictionary format</h3><a id="user-content-complex-dictionary-format" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Complex dictionary format" href="#complex-dictionary-format"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">For <code>COUNTRIES_ONLY</code> and <code>COUNTRIES_OVERRIDE</code>, you can also provide adictionary rather than just a translatable string for the country name.</p><p dir="auto">The options within the dictionary are:</p><dl><dt><code>name</code> or <code>names</code> (required)</dt><dd>Either a single translatable name for this country or a list of multipletranslatable names. If using multiple names, the first name takes preferencewhen using <code>COUNTRIES_FIRST</code> or the <code>Country.name</code>.</dd><dt><code>alpha3</code> (optional)</dt><dd>An ISO 3166-1 three character code (or an empty string to nullify an existingcode for this country.</dd><dt><code>numeric</code> (optional)</dt><dd>An ISO 3166-1 numeric country code (or <code>None</code> to nullify an existing codefor this country. The numeric codes 900 to 999 are left available by thestandard for user-assignment.</dd><dt><code>ioc_code</code> (optional)</dt><dd>The country's International Olympic Committee code (or an empty string tonullify an existing code).</dd></dl><a name="user-content-country-object-external-plugins"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>Country</code> object external plugins</h3><a id="user-content-country-object-external-plugins" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Country object external plugins" href="#country-object-external-plugins"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Other Python packages can add attributes to the <a href="#the-country-object">Country</a> object by using entrypoints in their setup script.</p><p dir="auto">For example, you could create a <code>django_countries_phone</code> package which had awith the following entry point in the <code>setup.py</code> file. The entry point name(<code>phone</code>) will be the new attribute name on the Country object. The attributevalue will be the return value of the <code>get_phone</code> function (called with theCountry instance as the sole argument).</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="setup(    ...    entry_points={        "django_countries.Country": "phone = django_countries_phone.get_phone"    },    ...)"><pre><span class="pl-en">setup</span>(    ...    <span class="pl-s1">entry_points</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span>{        <span class="pl-s">"django_countries.Country"</span>: <span class="pl-s">"phone = django_countries_phone.get_phone"</span>    },    ...)</pre></div><a name="user-content-django-rest-framework"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Django Rest Framework</h2><a id="user-content-django-rest-framework" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Django Rest Framework" href="#django-rest-framework"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Django Countries ships with a <code>CountryFieldMixin</code> to make the<a href="#countryfield">CountryField</a> model field compatible with DRF serializers. Use the followingmixin with your model serializer:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from django_countries.serializers import CountryFieldMixinclass CountrySerializer(CountryFieldMixin, serializers.ModelSerializer):    class Meta:        model = models.Person        fields = ("name", "email", "country")"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">django_countries</span>.<span class="pl-s1">serializers</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">CountryFieldMixin</span><span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">CountrySerializer</span>(<span class="pl-v">CountryFieldMixin</span>, <span class="pl-s1">serializers</span>.<span class="pl-v">ModelSerializer</span>):    <span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">Meta</span>:        <span class="pl-s1">model</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">models</span>.<span class="pl-v">Person</span>        <span class="pl-s1">fields</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> (<span class="pl-s">"name"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"email"</span>, <span class="pl-s">"country"</span>)</pre></div><p dir="auto">This mixin handles both standard and <a href="#multi-choice">multi-choice</a> country fields.</p><a name="user-content-django-rest-framework-field"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Django Rest Framework field</h3><a id="user-content-django-rest-framework-field" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Django Rest Framework field" href="#django-rest-framework-field"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">For lower level use (or when not dealing with model fields), you can use theincluded <code>CountryField</code> serializer field. For example:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="from django_countries.serializer_fields import CountryFieldclass CountrySerializer(serializers.Serializer):    country = CountryField()"><pre><span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s1">django_countries</span>.<span class="pl-s1">serializer_fields</span> <span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">CountryField</span><span class="pl-k">class</span> <span class="pl-v">CountrySerializer</span>(<span class="pl-s1">serializers</span>.<span class="pl-v">Serializer</span>):    <span class="pl-s1">country</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-v">CountryField</span>()</pre></div><p dir="auto">You can optionally instantiate the field with the <code>countries</code> argument tospecify a custom <a href="#single-field-customization">Countries</a> instance.</p><a name="user-content-rest-output-format"></a><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h4 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">REST output format</h4><a id="user-content-rest-output-format" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: REST output format" href="#rest-output-format"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">By default, the field will output just the country code. To output the fullcountry name instead, instantiate the field with <code>name_only=True</code>.</p><p dir="auto">If you would rather have more verbose output, instantiate the field with<code>country_dict=True</code>, which will result in the field having the followingoutput structure:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{"code": "NZ", "name": "New Zealand"}"><pre>{<span class="pl-ent">"code"</span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>NZ<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-ent">"name"</span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>New Zealand<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>}</pre></div><p dir="auto">Either the code or this dict output structure are acceptable as inputirregardless of the <code>country_dict</code> argument's value.</p><a name="user-content-options-request"></a><div class="markdown-heading"
